FS-NEAT is when your initial starting genome has very few 
connections. Lik=
e one output connected to only one or a few inputs 
instead of fully connec=
ted. This way evolution can choose to connect 
only inputs that are necessa=
ry for high fitness. 
Using subtractive mutations does help (using a mixtur=
e of additive 
and subtractive mutations is a blended search), but is not n=
ecessary 
for FS-NEAT to work. In fact, using a fully connected starting ge=
nome 
and subtractive mutations can be considered another form of feature 
=
selection since this way evolution can cut off connections from the 
unnece=
ssary inputs. 

Peter
